;kyc:
Special Instant Account: Achieve 2.5% profit, maintain 20% consistency, and have at least 5 profitable days.

Instant Pro Account: Achieve 4% profit, maintain 20% consistency, and have at least 5 profitable days.

Once all these requirements are met, you can open a ticket on our Discord or website support, or send us an email showing your eligibility. After verification, we will send you the KYC link via email within 24 to 48 business hours, and you can proceed to complete your KYC.
;consis:
Your consistency should be less than or equal to 20% to request a withdrawal. You will get 20% consistency only when you divide your highest profit in a day by 0.2 and achieve that target. Also, you must not make any day‚Äôs profit higher than your highest profit day.

Example:
If your highest profit in a single day is $50, then:
50 √∑ 0.2 = $250 (this becomes your total required profit for 20% consistency)

So, you must keep every other day‚Äôs profit below $50, and your total profit should reach $250 or more to meet the 20% consistency requirement.
;slrule:
Yes, all trades in the live phase must have a Stop Loss in place. While it doesn‚Äôt have to be set at the very start of the trade, it must be added before closing the trade.

Trades without a Stop Loss are considered a violation of our rules. Depending on the severity, the Payout Processing Team may take actions such as profit split adjustments, account reset, or, in extreme cases, a hard breach.

;2min:
All trades must be held for a minimum of 2 minutes.

Any trade closed before 2 minutes will be considered a violation of Next Level Funded rules.
;ip:
To maintain the integrity of our trading systems, your IP address must remain consistent in geographical location throughout your entire trading experience ‚Äî including both the evaluation and live simulated stages. We understand that some traders may need to switch between Wi-Fi and mobile data due to connectivity issues. This is permitted, provided that your IP address remains within the same regional area (i.e., the same city or nearby location). Frequent or significant changes in geographical IP location may result in account review or suspension for security purposes.
If you anticipate connectivity issues that may require wider location changes, please contact support before trading to avoid disruptions.
;faq:
Traders cannot open or close trades two minutes before or after a Red Folder news event release.

This includes:
Trades hitting take profit (TP) or profit target.
Pending orders being triggered.

Trades that were already open before the news event but close within the restricted time window.

If any trades are executed during this period and result in passing an evaluation, the account will not be considered as having passed the challenge.
We have an auto-close feature that closes trades once the profit target is reached. If your trade is automatically closed during a restricted news period, even with a TP set, it will be counted as a violation. Traders who pass based on news trades will not pass the challenge.
The same rule applies to Live Accounts. Any profits made from trades executed within the restricted news window will not be credited.
;ea: EAs are allowed, but they must follow our rules. If requested, you must prove that your EA is not violating any policies. HFT bots, hedge zone strategies, or similar methods are not allowed.
;cap:
All accounts are subject to a withdrawal cap structure:

‚Ä¢ First withdrawal: Maximum 3% cap
‚Ä¢ After first withdrawal: Cap increases to 8%
‚Ä¢ After second withdrawal: Cap is lifted, allowing withdrawals up to $10,000 every two payment cycles, in line with FAQ guidelines

1. Withdrawal Limits & Overflow System

‚Ä¢ Maximum withdrawal per cycle: Up to $10,000 every two withdrawal cycles per funded account
‚Ä¢ Profits exceeding $10,000 in a cycle will roll over to future cycles
‚Ä¢ Multiple funded accounts are treated as one entity, with withdrawal cycles based on the first account‚Äôs withdrawal timing

Example:
A trader earns $8,000 on the first withdrawal and $6,000 on the second withdrawal.
Only $10,000 can be withdrawn for the cycle, and the balance resets afterward.

2. Profit Restrictions Over $5,000

‚Ä¢ 50% cap rule: No single trade or best trading day may exceed 50% of total profit in a payout cycle
‚Ä¢ If exceeded, profits will be adjusted down to meet the 50% cap before withdrawal approval

Example:
If a single trade generates $10,000, only $5,000 will count toward withdrawal due to the 50% cap rule.

3. Maximum Lifetime Withdrawals & Scaling

‚Ä¢ Traders graduate from the Next Level Program after withdrawing a total of $100,000 across all challenges
‚Ä¢ After graduation, withdrawal limits increase as traders scale, allowing higher earning potential

These rules are designed to promote responsible risk management, sustainable payouts, and long-term trader success at Next Level Funded üöÄ

;day:
Example of consistency calculation:

Day 1: $1,000
Day 2: $1,200
Day 3: $1,000
Day 4: $1,100
Day 5: $900

In this example, Day 2 is the highest profit day at $1,200.

To meet the 20% consistency rule, your total profit must be $6,000 or more.

All other trading days must have profits equal to or lower than $1,200.
